Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Frivolity \Fri*vol"i*ty\, n.; pl. {Frivolities}. [Cg. F. frivolit['e]. See {Frivolous}.] The condition or quality of being frivolous; also, acts or habits of trifling; unbecoming levity of disposition. [1913 Webster]

frivolity n 1: the trait of being frivolous; not serious or sensible [syn: {frivolousness}] [ant: {seriousness}] 2: something of little value or significance [syn: {bagatelle}, {fluff}, {frippery}] 3: acting like a clown or buffoon [syn: {buffoonery}, {clowning}, {harlequinade}, {prank}]
